phrase.item: A partidge hugging her chick, a chick hugging its mother. [Partridges are the most beloved bird.]
Oh, my little brother is like a baby partidge.
Oh, spring came and the news of my brother spread everywhere.
Oh, unawareness of death
Oh my dear son is in the grave wearing his burial clothes [kafan].
Oh, I wail, and wonder at his destiny.
Oh, tell me that at night in the dark I won't get cold.
Oh, I wail
Oh, brother, we are complaining about your death.
Oh, how unfortunate that my Mirzoi Naimi has gone.
Oh, how sad that my Mirzoi Naimi has gone.
Oh my precious silver ring has gone.
Oh, the silver [...?]
Hey, friends and brothers, I wonder
Oh, please don't judge me.
Oh, for my bad deed I have lost my golden partridge.
Oh, the partridges are left in the graves.
Oh, the universe, the ways of the world,
Oh, I tell the young generation
Oh, I am in the topmost garden of sorrow.
Oh, I am wondering about my dear Miʂdʒon's life.
Oh my dear son in this temporary world, you spent your life happily.
Oh, I am wondering about the destiny about of my dearest son's soul.
Oh, dear son when the day of death comes, all reasons are...
Oh, for death, there is no cause or reason.
